scenario_text.value: Huh? Is that...Ryo?
That you, Takuma?

Fancy seeing you here again. We must have
been destined to be together.

As if! How can you say crap like that with
a straight face?

Ha ha, yeah, pretty funny, right? Anyway, I’d
better be going...

Hold on a sec, would you?! I wanted to talk
to you. Actually, you’ve got perfect timing.
Look, could you give me some advice?

Ask for all money as you want. You’re not
gonna find anywhere to spend it here.

Would you forget about the money already?!
That wasn’t even funny the first time!

What I want to know is, how do you get along
so well with Agumon?
Well, let me see...
What is it that helps us get along?
Skinship
Conditioning
Spartan discipline
I’d say the secret is skinship.

Skinship?! I’ve never even heard that word
before. Is it...something kinky?

Not at all. It’s about strengthening your
relationship through physical contact.
Physical c-contact? *gulp*...

(I think maybe he’s still got the wrong
idea...)

In other words, you spend time together,
expressing affection by what you say and do.

Like you might stroke him on the head, or
take him in an embrace.

T-take him in an embrace?! Man, this is
messed up!

I mean, there’s no need to get hung up about
it. Just express yourself with your body.

Sure... You’re, uh...surprisingly mature,
Takuma.
I think it’s all about conditioning.

Oh, yeah! I know about that! You mean like
training to get in shape?

Uh, not the type of conditioning I was
talking about.

Oh, right! You mean the other type of
conditioning! That makes sense.

(I’m...still not sure he knows what I’m
talking about.)

Basically, it’s using food and other rewards
to influence behavior and help build trust.

Actually, it might help to spend time
snacking and sharing meals in general.
Right. You sure know a lot of stuff, Takuma.

I don’t know, maybe the key is to use Spartan
discipline.

Oh, you think? So, how do you make discipline
Spartan?

(Has Ryo seriously never heard the word
“Spartan” before?)

Uh, it’s all about being very strict and
establishing dominance.

When your monster screws up, you scold it.
When it does well, you tell it to do better.
So you yell at it even when it’s doing well?
That’s how you establish dominance.
Not that I really like that approach.

So wait, you explain all that and then tell
me you don’t like it?
Right, well, uh... Okay. Anyway...

I’ve been getting this feeling lately that
I should get along better with Kunemon.

Like maybe things would start looking up more
if I could tell how he felt sometimes.

(I realize it’d be rude to say this, but I’m
surprised Ryo is being so thoughtful.)

I just wish I knew how to make that happen,
you know?

(I feel like maybe he’s starting to get a bit
more mature.)
